message_1: If cos(x) = 1/2, find the values of x in degrees between 0 and 360.
message_2:
The cosine function has a value of 1/2 at two angles in the range of 0 to 360 degrees. These angles are:

x = 60 degrees (which is π/3 in radians)
x = 300 degrees (which is 5π/3 in radians)

So, the values of x in degrees between 0 and 360 for which cos(x) = 1/2 are 60 degrees and 300 degrees.
